page.title: 06BBC Monitoring at Caversham
page.content: My father works for the BBC.He monitors Russian Television.He works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.He used to work night shifts _10 p.m to 7 a.m. He watches television nearly all day, first watching then monitoring the television. On the 13th of March the television news programme 'South Today' did an article on BBC Caversham.It was after the Soviet Leader had died .The people monitoring Soviet Central Television did not hear the programme preview for the following day as usual so they guessed something was amiss _ probably the death of Chernenko.The next day there were a lot of wildlife films and solemn music.Finally the announcement was made that Chernenko was dead.In that way BBC Caversham knew of the death of Chernenko before the Russian people.
